programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State (17-4, 7-3) dropped its last two games, but defeated the Jayhawks, 74-57, on Jan. 15 behind 25 points from Curtis Jones, who is third in the Big 12 with 17.9 ppg; Kansas (15-6, 6-4) is 10-2 at Allen Fieldhouse behind Hunter Dickinson.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Virginia (10-12, 3-8) is 2-7 away from home this season; Pittsburgh (14-7, 5-5) is 10-2 at home behind Jaland Lowe, who leads the Panthers with 17.4 ppg, and won its last two meetings with the Cavaliers after a 74-63 win last season.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of a particular athlete or issue that has captured the attention of sports fanatics across the nation; coverage includes exclusive interviews, exhaustive reporting and extensive expert analysis regarding the subject.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The most memorable games throughout the history of the NFL are replayed, reliving some of the marquee matchups on the biggest stages, impressive performances from the biggest names in the sport, unbelievable comebacks and playoff classics.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The top 10 title fights in UFC history are examined and explored, showcasing how these brawlers battled for vacant championships, defended titles or claimed them for their own; highlights share how these fights became instant classics.

programme.desc: From 1990-1993, the Buffalo Bills were known as much for their talent as their fighting in the locker room, but the team managed to come together to make a series of memorable Super Bowl runs that all ended in disappointment.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UNT (16-5, 7-2) had its six-game win streak snapped by UTSA, 54-50, on Feb. 1, but beat the Blazers, 78-75, on Dec. 31 behind 22 points from Atin Wright; UAB (14-8, 7-2) is 10-3 at home behind Yaxel Lendeborg, who is fifth in AAC scoring.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries
programme.desc: The life and career of Eugene F. "Buddy" Teevens III is celebrated, showcasing the groundbreaking innovations he brought to college football during his coaching tenure which spanned four decades and the impact he made off the field.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Duke and North Carolina State split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season with the Wolfpack claiming a 54-51 victory in the ACC Tournament quarterfinals on March 8; Aziaha James posted 16 points and 8 rebounds for NC State in the win.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: An update on all the top stories in college football, featuring interviews with players and coaches, analysis of the strongest teams in the country, evaluations of each major conference, and discussions on which schools are championship contenders.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at all things pertaining to college basketball, including previews of upcoming games, analysis of game-changing moments, discussions on breaking news, highlights of top players and more.

programme.title: German Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Leverkusen claimed victories over Köln in three of their last four meetings, including the most recent matchup on March 3 with a 2-0 scoreline; Jeremie Frimpong and Alejandro Grimaldo found the net for Leverkusen in the league win away from home.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The hosts do a top 10 countdown as they take an in-depth look at many of the greatest moments in the history of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and examine the most brutal knockouts, stunning upsets and devastating brawls.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Analysts cover National Signing Day, focusing on the top recruits from across the nation being signed by each program to fill positional needs, class rankings to see who is best in the nation and each conference, as well as the top surprises.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The 2000 Baltimore Ravens featured one of the most dominating defenses in NFL history and some of the more unique personalities throughout their roster as they shut down opposing teams on their way to a Super Bowl XXXV title over the New York Giants.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Indy is coming off of claiming a 3-0 victory over the Grand Rapids Rise on Jan. 16, led by 17 kills and 11 digs from Leketor Member-Meneh; Columbus suffered a 3-2 defeat to the Atlanta Vibe with 37 combined kills from Kaylee Cox and Morgan Lewis.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Top contenders Kyle Troup, Anthony Simonsen, Jason Belmonte, EJ Tackett and Bill O'Neill featured in the 2024 U.S. Open's championship round; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle at the Delaware Classic in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series heads to Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston-Salem, North Carolina for the first of two exhibition races in the 2025 season; Bowman Gray Stadium is back to hosting the NASCAR Cup Series for the first time since 1971.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: TCU and Iowa State last met on Feb. 25, 2023, where the Cyclones claimed an 84-56 victory over the Horned Frogs behind Ashley Joens' 22 points and 11 rebounds; Tomi Taiwo posted 13 points and 2 rebounds for TCU in the road defeat.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball

programme.desc: Vegas (3-2), which had its two-game winning streak snapped with a 3-1 loss on the road to Atlanta on Jan. 23, defeated the Valkyries, 3-2, on Jan. 19; Orlando (2-2) is unbeaten at home in 2025.
